column4: can i duplicate my server simply by backing up all the files and restoring them to new ubuntu instance?
damn it..
the problem is that i don't have a place to store the backup on the server..
Gentoo64/thunsucker: i was thinking of mounting a windows share but i can't seem to access the file share from outside my network.
(ie. share on my local machine mounted on my linux server to create the location to store the backup)
If you try to access it from outside your network, you will have to take that up with your router, (or your sysadmin).
Yes.  I tried moving that machine to the dmz but that didn't help as well as port forward.
Well, that's what it takes, port forwarding.
Or create an alias on the router for it, (that is if you have another outside IP).
trying to mount windows fileshare here what i was trying to do - http://www.liberiangeek.net/2010/08/mount-windows-shares-ubuntu-10-04-lucid-lynx-terminal/
but if you expose the server directly to the internet, you loose the security of being behind the router.
my local machine(win7) is behind a router the server(ubuntu10.04) is on the net
samba file sharing is designed to be done within a LAN
Punching a whole trhough a router for a samba share is beyond the scope of ubuntu support.
